meanings.definition: A person or thing that makes something uniform.
meanings.sent1: The uniformer ensured that all the students were dressed the same way.
meanings.sent2: The tailor was a skilled uniformer, making sure all the suits were identical.
meanings.sent3: The paint roller, the uniformer of walls, was on a mission to make every surface the same color.
meanings.sent4: The chef, a uniformer of flavors, blended the ingredients perfectly to create a harmonious dish.
meanings.sent5: The organizer acted as a uniformer, arranging all the books on the shelf by size and color.

meanings.sent1: After the laundry, the clothes looked much cleaner and uniformer.
meanings.sent2: The rows of trees in the orchard were planted in a uniformer pattern.
meanings.sent3: The clouds in the sky seemed to form a uniformer shape, resembling a giant cotton ball.
meanings.sent4: The stars in the night sky appeared uniformer, creating a breathtaking view.
meanings.sent5: The students' handwriting became neater and uniformer with practice.
